column4: Some advice pls: Can I install Linux on an eee pc netbook, (atom) and how good is this?
yes you can. I have it on a 701 4G so even the lowest spec can handle it, if you don't expect too much
thnx for that. It wld hv to be faster than Windoze, surely? And in ur experience, why shld I "not expect too much"?
well it depends what model you are installing it on. Don't expect much frm unity on a 401, for example. But if you run openbox or something light on a 401, it's fine.
I was thinking og getting an Asus eee pc and intsall Linux
if you buy a newer, faster model, you should be fine on all respects. But I have no anecdotal evidence to share except on a 401
